questions.title: Question 1 for Class CLIMATE102_191016
questions.main: What causes the wind to blow?
questions.answer: Wind will blow if there is a gradient in pressure in the horizontal.

questions.title: Question 2 for Class CLIMATE102_191016
questions.answer: A) the direction from which the wind is blowing

mcq.option: A) the direction from which the wind is blowing
B) the direction to which the wind is blowing
C) always directly from high toward low pressure
D) always directly from low toward high pressure

questions.title: Question 3 for Class CLIMATE102_191016
questions.main: Describe how the wind blows around areas of surface low- and high-pressure in the Northern Hemisphere.
questions.answer: In the Northern Hemisphere surface winds blow counterclockwise and in toward an area of low pressure; they blow clockwise and outward around an area of high pressure.

questions.title: Question 4 for Class CLIMATE102_191016
questions.main: The pressure gradient force is directed from higher pressure toward lower pressure:
questions.answer: E) at all places on earth

mcq.option: A) only at the equator
B) at all places on earth except for the equator
C) only in the Northern Hemisphere
D) only in the Southern Hemisphere
E) at all places on earth

questions.title: Question 5 for Class CLIMATE102_191016
questions.main: On a surface weather map why do the winds cross the isobars?
questions.answer: Friction slows the wind hence reducing the effect of the Coriolis force allowing the pressure gradient force to draw air toward the center of the low.

questions.title: Question 6 for Class CLIMATE102_191016
questions.main: Hurricanes can't form along the equator because
questions.answer: B) the Coriolis force is too small along the equator

mcq.option: A) there isn't much water along the equator, it's mostly land
B) the Coriolis force is too small along the equator
C) there are no feedback mechanisms along the equator
D) it's too humid for the ocean water to evaporate

questions.title: Question 7 for Class CLIMATE102_191016
questions.main: Why is the hottest region of the world in the subtropical deserts of the Northern Hemisphere and not at the equator?
questions.answer: At the equator the air tends to be more humid so more energy goes into evaporation.  Also at the equator there tend to be more clouds that will reflect sunlight from the surface.

questions.title: Question 8 for Class CLIMATE102_191016
questions.main: In the middle latitudes of the Northern Hemisphere surface winds tend to blow ____ and ____ around an area of surface high pressure.

mcq.option: A) clockwise, inward
B) clockwise, outward
C) counterclockwise, inward
D) counterclockwise, outward

questions.title: Question 9 for Class CLIMATE102_191016
questions.main: In the middle latitudes of the Northern Hemisphere surface winds tend to blow ____ and ____ around an area of surface low pressure.

mcq.option: A) clockwise, inward
B) clockwise, outward
C) counterclockwise, inward
D) counterclockwise, outward

questions.title: Question 10 for Class CLIMATE102_191016
questions.answer: C) around surface low pressure centers in the Northern and Southern Hemispheres

mcq.option: A) around surface low pressure centers in the Northern Hemisphere only
